title: Smart Packages sells $380m Smartgroup stake via Macquarie
text:
Macquarie's equities desk is seeking buyers for 32 million shares in leasing company Smartgroup on Thursday afternoon.

The broker was asking for bids at $11.30 a share, in a block worth $370 million.

It is understood Macquarie was selling on behalf of Smart Packages Pte Ltd, which is a Malaysian group and owns a 25 per cent in the company.

The stock last traded at $12.10.

Smart Packages was Smartgroup's largest shareholder. It is an indirect subsidiary of Usaha Tega, which is a private investment holding company based in Malaysia.

Smart Packages controlled Smartgroup prior to the Australian company's sharemarket float in 2014 when it retained a 30 per cent stake.
description: Macquarie's equities desk is seeking buyers for 32 million shares in leasing company Smartgroup on Thursday afternoon.
